sentences.english: Create a treasure hunt with some blogging friends.
sentences.chinese: 和一些博友组建一支寻宝队。

sentences.english: Island bag on my, and everyone will command the sign of the quest get start.
sentences.chinese: 岛袋一声令下，人人就依据本人获得的记号开端寻宝。

sentences.english: Have the news inside course of study " dragon definitely " disgraced, large quantities of ghoul admire names find treasure.
sentences.chinese: 有业内消息“龙决”现世，大批盗墓者慕名寻宝。

sentences.english: Since the Spanish conquest, Peruhas beckoned treasure-seeking foreigners.
sentences.chinese: 自从被西班牙征服，秘鲁就吸引着寻宝的外国人。

sentences.english: So the treasure-seekers should beware that the Arctic may take its revenge.
sentences.chinese: 因此，那些寻宝者应该小心了，北极可能会进行报复。

sentences.english: Make a treasure map of the best x-mas lights in your town.
sentences.chinese: 做一张能发现城里最酷的圣诞灯光寻宝图。

sentences.english: Come , Dowsed in mud , Soaked in bleach.
sentences.chinese: 来，到糟粕里寻宝，在漂白剂里浸礼。

sentences.english: Seeking love is like exploring treaure inremote mountains. No one can guaranteeyour success;
sentences.chinese: 爱的寻觅就像深山寻宝，没有谁保你一定成功。

sentences.english: She gave speeches describing the destruction of the dwellings by people seeking treasures.
sentences.chinese: 她用演讲描述那些寻宝的人对遗址造成的破坏。

sentences.english: Dr Hopkins is a small boy, he was eager and enthusiastic about the sea treasure hunt .
sentences.chinese: 何金斯是一个小男孩，他渴望并且热衷于出海寻宝。

sentences.english: There is nothing like a good old fashioned treasure hunt.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么比老式的寻宝更好了。

sentences.english: And these treasure hunters know it.
In fact, piracy and treasure hunting has probably existed since ships were able to traverse the oceans.
sentences.chinese: 实际上可能自从出现远洋后就有了海盗及寻宝活动。

sentences.english: The Treasure or Scavenger Hunt is simple.

definition: to explore/to go on an expedition/adventure
precious mineral deposits/hidden treasure/(fig.) treasure/(Buddhism) the treasure of Buddha's law
to try one's luck/to leave sth to chance
a rare treasure/sth priceless and unique
lit. nest of devils/place occupied by sinister forces
to look for/to seek/to find fault
treasure-house/treasury/treasure-trove (often fig., book of treasured wisdom)
